Computer_Science_tweet_195_r$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: The second laws of #quantum thermodynamics @username #physics
Finding B: The analysis also revealed that bots amplify a message's volume and visibility until it's more likely to be shared broadly, despite only representing a small fraction of the accounts that spread viral messages.
Finding C: Other key findings from the study: Charging for the first or second checked bag improved on-time departure performance for all major airlines--including Southwest Airlines, which does not charge for the first two bags--because it creates savings due to a cultural shift among US passengers to travel with less baggage.
Finding D: The research demonstrated that NPP is able to significantly outperform the current state-of-the-art methods in predicting node degree centrality.

Computer_Science_0_r$Computer_Science_44.text:
Finding A: Terekhov and his colleagues showed that the notion of space as environment-independent cannot be deduced only by exteroceptive information, as this information varies greatly depending on what is found in the environment.
Finding B: The study described in this paper focuses on gaze, but similar approaches can be used to understand the effects of other interactions that contribute to patient outcomes such as emotion.
Finding C: Significance-This is the first demonstration of adaptive DBS in Parkinson\'s disease using a fully implanted device and neural sensing.
Finding D: Our study provides a tantalizing glimpse into what may lie ahead in virtual-environment-based tools to enhance human memory.

Computer_Science_tweet_138_r$Computer_Sc.text:
Finding A: A very interesting study appeared recently in Arxiv on spatial notions for robotic systems. According to the researchers, the robots should develop its own perceptual notions, analyzing its sensorimotor experiences and identifying meaningful patterns. #AI
Finding B: The overall improvement from pre to post was 11.3 % in the mixed-reality conditions and 2.4 % in the virtual conditions.
Finding C: The curves are higher for messages sent by women than for those sent by men-women are more likely than men to receive replies-but among both women and men the probability of a reply is a decreasing function of desirability gap, more desirable partners replying at lower rates than less desirable ones.
Finding D: Read @username study in @username about big data stored in a drop of DNA:

Computer_Science_439_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Our analysis suggests that papers with shorter titles do receive greater numbers of citations.
Finding B: The neurosynaptic system described so far provides the basic structure needed for supervised learning tasks, where the weights of the inputs are set by an external supervisor.
Finding C: Whilst the duration of the interaction for FTF positively predicted happiness, there was no effect of duration on happiness for the other modes, including those CMC modes that included auditory cues (Skype and telephone).
Finding D: "There are some people who have highly desirable traits and are going to be more in demand, so they\'re going to be able to be choosier about who they mate with.
Computer_Science_439_p$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: Our analysis suggests that papers with shorter titles do receive greater numbers of citations.
Finding B: The neurosynaptic system described so far provides the basic structure needed for supervised learning tasks, where the weights of the inputs are set by an external supervisor.
Finding C: Whilst the duration of the interaction for FTF positively predicted happiness, there was no effect of duration on happiness for the other modes, including those CMC modes that included auditory cues (Skype and telephone).
Finding D: "There are some people who have highly desirable traits and are going to be more in demand, so they\'re going to be able to be choosier about who they mate with.

Computer_Science_88_p$Computer_Science_3.text:
Finding A: This suggests an exciting opportunity for the role of immersive virtual environments in assisting in recall.
Finding B: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.
Finding C: Men were nearly twice as likely as women to consider mobile phone use at a business lunch acceptable.
Finding D: When cooking tender meats, it\'s the fast changes that are the most important because the slow changes are mainly used to increase tenderness.

Computer_Science_8_r$Computer_Science_30.text:
Finding A: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding B: Our approach led to gains of roughly 40 to 70%, on average, in refugees\' employment outcomes relative to current assignment practices.
Finding C: "The initial findings could have been explained by a correlation, that people with big hippocampi become taxi drivers," he says.
Finding D: When groups are forced to go head-to-head with each other, we expect those composed of men to exhibit higher levels of creativity relative to groups composed of women.

Finding A: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding B: Our approach led to gains of roughly 40 to 70%, on average, in refugees\' employment outcomes relative to current assignment practices.
Finding C: "The initial findings could have been explained by a correlation, that people with big hippocampi become taxi drivers," he says.
Finding D: When groups are forced to go head-to-head with each other, we expect those composed of men to exhibit higher levels of creativity relative to groups composed of women.

Computer_Science_16_r$Computer_Science_2.text:
Finding A: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding B: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn\'t cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Finding C: Our analysis reveals clear differences between how the left-and right-wing figures created and transmitted patterns of language use.
Finding D: The hippocampus in humans is therefore necessary for facilitating navigation even when the navigator is an expert of very longstanding.

Finding B: Moreover, the bias blind spot does not appear to be a facet of general decision-making ability or an accurate perception of the extent to which one is biased.
